intro: Gomesa novaesiae, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to Brazil, characterized by its small, fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, yellow, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Gomesa novaesiae is valued both for its ornamental appeal and its culinary uses.
